It hangs in my office as a reminder that we can do what seems nearly impossible. We can bring groups together that seem far apart. We can be bipartisan in the way that we approach this. I worry our relationship w/Israel is becoming a partisan issue, but to succeed, it cannot.

This week, I spoke with @SecPompeo about the recent attacks in Israel and efforts from the US to strengthen & secure Israel with United States. I also got to show a @Jerusalem_Post newspaper clipping that I've kept for 40 years- from the signing of the Israel-Egypt peace treaty. pic.twitter.com/lSIlJtKeiC

I don't believe here in DC we know better than the local elected officials or the local tribes. We can only resolve these issues by deescalating the divisiveness, the ‚Äòwinner-take-all‚Äô philosophy, and sitting down with the various interest groups as we did in San Juan County.

I‚Äôm absolutely convinced there‚Äôs a strong desire in Utah among the elected officials and the constituents to protect and preserve these very important and scared areas. That‚Äôs never been in question. What has been in question, is who gets to make those decisions?
